creator: vdv@dyomedea.com
text:
A xs:QName should be invalid if the prefix doesn't match a namespace declaration
and the example below should *not* validate:

XML:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<datatypes xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="anytype.xsd"
xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
	<any xsi:type="xs:QName">foo:bar</any>
</datatypes>
XSD:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<xs:schema xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
	<xs:element name="datatypes">
		<xs:complexType>
			<xs:sequence>
				<xs:element name="any" type="xs:anySimpleType" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="unbounded"/>
			</xs:sequence>
		</xs:complexType>
	</xs:element>
</xs:schema>
